verses.verse: Who is this that comes<WH935> from Edom<WH123>, with dyed<WH2556> garments<WH899> from Bozrah<WH1224>? this who is glorious<WH1921> in his apparel<WH3830>, travelling<WH6808> in the greatness<WH7230> of his strength<WH3581>? I that speak<WH1696> in righteousness<WH6666>, mighty<WH7227> to save<WH3467>.
Why are you red<WH122> in your apparel<WH3830>, and your garments<WH899> like him that treads<WH1869> in the winefat<WH1660>?

I have trodden<WH1869> the winepress<WH6333> alone<WH5971>; and of the people there was none<WH376> with me<WH1869>: for I will tread them in my anger<WH639>, and trample<WH7429> them in my fury<WH2534>; and their blood<WH5332> shall be sprinkled<WH5137> upon my garments<WH899>, and I will stain<WH1351> all my clothes<WH4403>.
For the day<WH3117> of vengeance<WH5359> is in my heart<WH3820>, and the year<WH8141> of my redeemed<WH1350> is come<WH935>.

And I looked<WH5027>, and there was none to help<WH5826>; and I wondered<WH8074> that there was none to uphold<WH5564>: therefore my own arm<WH2220> brought salvation<WH3467> unto me<WH2534>; and my fury, it upheld me<WH5564>.
And I will tread down<WH947> the people<WH5971> in my anger<WH639>, and make them drunk<WH7937> in my fury<WH2534>, and I will bring down<WH3381> their strength<WH5332> to the earth<WH776>.

I will mention<WH2142> the lovingkindnesses<WH2617> of the Lord<WH3068>, and the praises<WH8416> of the Lord<WH3068>, according to all that the Lord<WH3068> has bestowed<WH1580> on us<WH7227>, and the great goodness<WH2898> toward the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478>, which he has bestowed<WH1580> on them according to his mercies<WH7356>, and according to the multitude<WH7230> of his lovingkindnesses<WH2617>.
For he said<WH559>, Surely they are my people<WH5971>, sons<WH1121> that will not lie<WH8266>: so he was their Savior<WH3467>.

In all their affliction<WH6869> he was afflicted<WH6862>, and the angel<WH4397> of his presence<WH6440> saved<WH3467> them<WH160>: in his love and in his pity<WH2551> he redeemed<WH1350> them<WH5190>; and he bore them<WH5375>, and carried them all the days<WH3117> of old<WH5769>.
But they rebelled<WH4784>, and troubled<WH6087> his holy<WH6944> Spirit<WH7307>: therefore he was turned<WH2015> to be their enemy<WH341>, and he fought against them<WH3898>.

Then he remembered<WH2142> the days<WH3117> of old<WH5769>, Moses<WH4872>, and his people<WH5971>, saying<WH5927>, Where is he that brought them up out of the sea<WH3220> with the shepherd<WH7462> of his flock<WH6629>? where is he that put<WH7760> his holy<WH6944> Spirit<WH7307> inside him<WH7130>?

That led<WH3212> them by the right hand<WH3225> of Moses<WH4872> with his glorious<WH8597> arm<WH2220>, dividing<WH1234> the water<WH4325> before<WH6440> them<WH6213>, to make himself a everlasting<WH5769> name<WH8034>?
That led<WH3212> them through the deep<WH8415>, as a horse<WH5483> in the wilderness<WH4057>, that they should not stumble<WH3782>?

As a animal<WH929> goes down<WH3381> into the valley<WH1237>, the Spirit<WH7307> of the Lord<WH3068> caused him to rest<WH5117>: so did you lead<WH5090> your people<WH5971>, to make<WH6213> yourself a glorious<WH8597> name<WH8034>.

Look down<WH5027> from heaven<WH8064>, and behold<WH7200> from the habitation<WH2073> of your holiness<WH6944> and of your glory<WH8597>: where is your zeal<WH7068> and your strength<WH1369>, the yearning<WH1995> of your heart<WH4578> and of your mercies<WH7356> toward me<WH662>? are they restrained?

Doubtless<WH3588> you are our father<WH1>, though Abraham<WH85> be ignorant<WH3808> of us<WH3478>, and Israel acknowledge<WH5234> us not<WH3068>: you, O Lord, are our father<WH1>, our redeemer<WH1350>; your name<WH8034> is from everlasting<WH5769>.

O Lord<WH3068>, why have you made us to err<WH8582> from your ways<WH1870>, and hardened<WH7188> our heart<WH3820> from your fear<WH3374>? Return<WH7725> for your servants<WH5650>' sake<WH7626>, the tribes of your inheritance<WH5159>.
The people<WH5971> of your holiness<WH6944> have possessed<WH3423> it but a little while<WH4705>: our adversaries<WH6862> have trodden down<WH947> your sanctuary<WH4720>.
We are yours<WH5769>: you never bore rule<WH4910> over them<WH7121>; they were not called by your name<WH8034>.
